div.h2:
WELCOME TO THE MEADOW HEIGHTS
R-II SCHOOL

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto, Arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);
font-size: 14px; letter-spacing: 0.2px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

span.span: The regularly scheduled Board Meeting scheduled for Monday, April 13, 2020 has been cancelled due to the COVID-19 shelter in place

span.style: font-size: 14px; letter-spacing: 0.2px; white-space: pre-wrap; color: rgb(0, 0, 0);
font-size: 14px; letter-spacing: 0.2px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(34, 34, 34);

span.span: . The Meadow Heights R-II School Board will meet next on Monday, May 11, 2020.

span.style: font-size: 14px; letter-spacing: 0.2px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);
letter-spacing: 0.2px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);

span.span: FREE lunch/breakfast resource for children 18 and under.

span.style: font-size: 14px; letter-spacing: 0.2px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);
white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; color: rgb(255, 0, 0);
font-size: 11pt;
font-size: 14px; letter-spacing: 0.2px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Roboto, Arial, sans-serif;

span.span: Please complete by 8:30am on the day food is needed.

span.style: font-size: 11pt;
font-size: 11pt;

span.span: for the fillable form or call or text 573-576-9318. We will have curbside pickups and pickup places on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays until Wednesday, May 13.

span.style: font-size: 18px;

span.strong: Summer School is tentatively scheduled for June 1st through 26th if social distancing rules are lifted by May 26 if not then Summer School will be held July 6th through 31st if social distancing rules are lifted by June 22nd. Offices will be open for phone calls beginning Monday, April 27, 2020 from 8:30 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Please sign up at this link:

strong.span: or call the elementary office beginning Monday, April 27 from 8:00 a.m to 2:00 p.m.

span.style: font-size: 11pt;
font-size: 11pt;

p.style: background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;

strong.style: color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;

p.strong:
The Meadow Heights R-II School District will remained closed for the remainder of the school year. We will continue to service lunch/breakfasts for children 18 and under by curbside pickup at Meadow Heights from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m., at the Sedgewickville Store at 11:00 a.m., at the intersection of Hwy. O and 72 at 11:25 a.m., at the intersection of Hwy. N and 51 at 11:40 a.m., and at Hwy. 51 Express at 12:00 p.m. on Monday, Wednesday, and Fridays until May 13, 2020. If you would like to sign up for lunch/breakfasts and have not already done so, please log on to: https://forms.gle/a68g5ED2LLW4MUmTA or text 573-576-9318 with the number of meals needed and where you will be picking them up.
Students third quarter grades will be their semester grades. If that grade is an F, the teachers will be contacting you to redo/resubmit/submit assignments to achieve a passing grade.
The next set of packets for students in PreK through 5th grade will be handed out April 29th at school from 4 p.m. to 7 p.m. At that time, spring pictures and elementary personal items from desks will also be handed out. Elementary students will also need to turn in library books and textbooks they have at home.
Mr. Nanney will be sending out information for specific for seniors and students in grades 6th-11th concerning locker clean outs, personal items pickups, and returning chrome books, library books, and textbooks.
We will still award academic and athletic awards. Certificates will be handed out in May and individuals will be recognized on the Meadow Heights Facebook page.
Graduation is planned for Saturday, June 13 at 10:00. If social restrictions are lifted, it will be held in the gym as in the past. If social restrictions are not lifted, it will be held outside on the baseball field with only immediate family members present. In case of rain and it is outside, we will hold graduation on Sunday, June 14.
Prom is scheduled for June 27 at Meadow Heights. If social distancing rules are not lifted by June 1st, Prom will be cancelled.
Summer School is tentatively scheduled for June 1st through 26th if social distancing rules are lifted by May 26 if not then Summer School will be held July 6th through 31st if social distancing rules are lifted by June 22nd.
Offices will be open for phone calls beginning Monday, April 27, 2020 from 8:30 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.
Our thoughts and prayers are with the Meadow Heights Families during this difficult time. Please contact us if we can help in any way. Please continue to practice social distancing and stay safe.
Donna

h2.span: Due to COVID-19 all events are cancelled.

div.p: Meadow Heights R-II School does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district’s activities and programs. Meadow Heights R-II School also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.
